intro: Stenodiptera platycarpa, commonly known as the broad-fruited sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family, which includes many species adapted to drought conditions. The plant is characterized by its prostrate growth habit, hairy stems, and small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, and it thrives in sandy or gravelly soils. Stenodiptera platycarpa is often used in traditional medicine and is valued for its hardy nature in challenging environments.
